imdb.title: Gyakkyô burai Kaiji
imdb.plot: Kaiji Itou is a good-for-nothing loiterer who spends his days drinking beer and stealing hubcaps-that is, until he ends up being tricked by his former co-worker. Unable to suddenly repay his friend's huge debt all by himself, Kaij...

episodes.title: Hell on Earth
episodes.plot: Months later, Kaiji meets Endo again, who kidnaps Kaiji and forces him into manual labor, constructing a nuclear fallout shelter for 15 years to pay his debt. After losing his saved up money, Kaiji joins the underground gambling circle.

episodes.title: Cardinal Rule of Game
episodes.plot: Kaiji agrees to borrow 60,000 perica from foreman Otsuki to play cee-lo. The foreman explains the rules of the game. Kaiji starts playing with small bets, but later he bets 3,000 perica. He loses, but it fires him up to go all out to win.

episodes.title: Piece of Luck
episodes.plot: After his initial loses, Kaiji keeps betting 3,000 multiple times during the night. Later he bets 5,000, and has a good win. However, Otsuki and his cohort Isawa Kaoru tricking him, making Kaiji fall further into debt hell.

episodes.title: Strikes Clues
episodes.plot: Weeks later, Kaiji is in a group of 6 men called the Forty-fivers, who receive only half of their salaries. Kaiji figures out how Otsuki is cheating, and then convinces the Forty-fivers to pool their money to beat him.

episodes.title: Abuse and Perseverance
episodes.plot: Kaiji meets the son of Ishida, Hiromitsu, who blames his father for not bailing him out of dept. After three months, Kaiji and the Forty-fivers all return to full pay. On gambling night, Kaiji proposes no betting limit, and Otsuki accepts.

episodes.title: Neppu no Torai
episodes.plot: Kaiji and Otsuki prepare to face each other. For the first few matches, Kaiji does not bet over the old limit, but on a challenge from Otsuki who must deal twice, the Kaiji and Forty-fivers are going all-in, for a total of 507,000 perica.

episodes.title: Maho no Sai
episodes.plot: When the foreman sees the large bet, he suspects that Kaiji has discovered how he is cheating with a special dice. Otsuki is forced to play with normal one, but then on the last throw he uses his special dice, and Kaiji grabs it.

episodes.title: Ingaoho
episodes.plot: Kaiji shows everyone that Otsuki is cheating, then tricks the foreman into betting again while they use their own special dice, making Otsuki lose 2,535,000 perica in total. When Otsuki was about to give up, Kaiji lands his finishing blow.

episodes.title: Kassai, Soshite...
episodes.plot: After Otsuki losing 18,252,000 perica, the team wants Kaiji to keep the money and twenty one-day outside pass to gamble for them. Outside, after teaming up with Sakazaki, Kaiji eyes The Bog, a pachinko machine with a ¥550 million jackpot.

episodes.title: Saigo no Bakuchi
episodes.plot: Kaiji finds out that the Bog is rigged. Sakazaki is secretive about the details of his plan. He 'borrowes' ¥50 million from a company president's safe. On the appointed day, Sakazaki commences to play the Bog.

episodes.title: Kanki to Tansei
episodes.plot: Sakazaki starts to play the Bog, using ¥10 million, and an another ¥10 million later. Kaiji overhears the security men talk of a device to prevent anyone winning. He warns Sakazaki's, but in his gambling frenzy he uses up all the money.

episodes.title: Haten Hakan
episodes.plot: While Sakazaki continues losing, the casino manager, Ichijo Seiya, initiate the 'block' that stops the balls descending into the winning zone. Kaiji leaves with around ¥6 million. The next day, he gathers information about the casino.

episodes.title: Koryaku no Itoguchi
episodes.plot: Kaiji returns to Sakazaki's apartment, only to find it trashed and empty. Kaiji tracks Sakazaki down at a racetrack. He approaches Endo who is now broke but agrees to help. They end up agreeing to split the winnings three ways after costs.

episodes.title: Soshuhen
episodes.plot: A small intermission, summarizing the events of all the previous episodes.

episodes.title: Koke no Isshin
episodes.plot: Sakazaki plays the Bog again in disguise, then attacks and damages it. Ichijo realizes that it's a distraction, runs to his office to find Kaiji there. Days later, the Bog is repaired. On his final day on the surface, Kaiji makes his move.

episodes.title: Kessen no Makuake
episodes.plot: Kaiji starts playing and more balls than expected drop between the pins and Ichijo is suspicious. He realize that Kaiji somehow entered the staff room and doctored the setting gauges. Panicking, Ichijo has the 'block' turned on.

episodes.title: Fumo na Kantetsu
episodes.plot: Kaiji plays on even though it appears the chances of winning are zero. Meanwhile, Ichijo receives a request to send a live CCTV feed to the Teiai underground labor camp and to Hyodo. Kaiji continues to play, even after losing ¥20 million.

episodes.title: Teppeki no Mon
episodes.plot: Kaiji continues to play until one ball makes it through to the plates below. The flipper rods bent because the replacements were modified by Kaiji. Ichijo is panicking, and receives a call from Hyodo telling him to let the game continue.

episodes.title: Kiseki no Kido
episodes.plot: Kaiji has only ¥20 million left to try and beat the Bog. Slowly Ichijo comes to realize that Kaiji managed to not only tilt the machine to increase his odds of winning, but also create a favorable tilt on the casino building itself.

episodes.title: Shukuun no Sa
episodes.plot: Kaiji's plan pays off, and he gets closer to winning with more balls dropping onto the third plate. Ichijo tilts the machine again in the same direction to prevent balls reaching the final plate as Kaiji uses his last ¥10 million.

episodes.title: Kakujitsu na Shori
episodes.plot: Kaiji plays on, but he is on the verge of defeat, having lost all his money. He convinces Endo to lend him his last ¥10 million against his better judgment, but at an unreal interest rate. Kaiji returns to the machine for a final assault.

episodes.title: Yukichi no Iko
episodes.plot: Kaiji commences to play, as the crowd watches, a number of balls circulating on the plates because the losing holes have become clogged with balls which are unable to exit the machine. This increases Kaiji's probability of winning.

episodes.title: Fuzen no Tomoshibi
episodes.plot: Kaiji realizes too late that the lean they created possibly eliminating his chances of a ball dropping into the rear winning hole. Also, the clogged balls may soon drop out. He is now in a race against time before the money runs out.

episodes.title: Haikai Suru Gin-dama
episodes.plot: Kaiji plays until the losing holes on even the third plate are blocked; however, Ichijo has the final weapon - air jets around the winning hole to deflect the balls. Kaiji is forced to play his remaining balls and pray for a miracle.

episodes.title: Ensa no Namida
episodes.plot: Kaiji has run out of money, but Sakazaki appears and gives Kaiji another ¥10 million 'borrowed' company money. As the plate overflowing with balls, some cascade down the winning hole. Hyodo sentences Ichijo to 1,050 years underground.

episodes.title: Mirai wa bokura no...
episodes.plot: Kaiji's friends cash in ¥729 million. During a night of drinking, Endo drugs them, leaving Kaiji just over ¥61 million. On the day the Forty-fivers arrival, Kaiji is too ashamed to meet them but one of the men in black takes pity on him.

episodes.title: Shukkô
episodes.plot: Kaiji learns about his debt from endou 'a loan shark' and must decide if he wants to take up endou's proposal about gambling.

episodes.title: Hibuta
episodes.plot: Aboard the Espoir, Kaiji finds himself with hundreds of people who also have debts. "Restricted Rock Paper Scissors" is announced as the gambling event that will be played by Kaiji and the other debtors on board the ship.

episodes.title: Shôbu
episodes.plot: After being tricked by Funai, Kaiji meets the former co-worker who got him into debt, Furuhata Takeshi. Kaiji teams up with him and finds another person to join their team, named Ando Mamoru. Kaiji comes up with another plan to win.

episodes.title: Hatan
episodes.plot: With only ¥14 million and no cards, Kaiji begins to think strategically. He comes up with a plan to monopolize the game by first acquiring 30 Rock cards. But another group thought of the same strategy. Kaiji then challenges their leader.

episodes.title: Kesshi
episodes.plot: Kaiji challenges Kitami to a Rock Paper Scissors death match. Kaiji successfully guesses which card he has and beats him, winning 3 stars. He then hatches a plan of buying out all 30 Paper cards held by the Kitami group.

episodes.title: Kôbô
episodes.plot: Kaiji buys out the Kitami group's Paper cards. Funai offers Kaiji a deal to trade his star for a few cards, but Kaiji refuses. With everyone's hand is being leaked, Funai proposes that they should reshuffle the cards, ruining Kaiji's plan.

episodes.title: Kappa
episodes.plot: The Rock Paper Scissors gambling event is nearing its end and Kaiji's group is forced to join Funai's idea of reshuffling. However Funai cheats to lower Kaiji's chances. Kaiji now prepares to challenge Funai, who is holding 9 stars.

episodes.title: Kanazuchi
episodes.plot: Kaiji challenges Funai to a final match. Funai is reluctantly accepts the unfair wager. After winning, Kaiji gives the 5 new stars and the money to his team, trusting that they will get him out from the dark room in the buy-sell period.

episodes.title: Kaisei
episodes.plot: Ando betrays Kaiji by selling his extra star and it doesn't take long for Furuhata to desert him as well. After Kaiji finding his way out, he confronts his former allies. With his new wealth, Kaiji buys the freedom of another man, Ishida.

episodes.title: Shisha
episodes.plot: Kaiji was able to survive the event, but is left with a new debt of ¥6,295,000. Four months later, Kaiji is working at a convenience store, still in debt and poverty. One night, Endo appears before him, offering a chance to clear his debt.

episodes.title: Kyôun
episodes.plot: Kaiji accepts the invitation to the next gambling event, the "Human Derby", where the entrants must cross a high, narrow beam to reach their goal. Soon, the contestants realize they must push the one in front of them off the beam to win.

episodes.title: Tenraku
episodes.plot: Kaiji decides not to push the player in front of him to win, and gets disqualified. The survivors must participate in "Electrified Steel Beam Crossing" to collect their winnings or, like Kaiji, compete for one remaining bonus ticket.

episodes.title: Kaibutsu
episodes.plot: Ten people including Kaiji volunteer to cross the electrified beam bridge. Kaiji tries to have their morale lifted, and they begin to cross the beams, but the demon of fear grabs hold of them and two soon falls to their deaths.

episodes.title: Bôrei
episodes.plot: The remaining 8 wants to give up but Tonegawa ignores their pleas of mercy. Soon, only Kaiji, Sahara and Ishida remain. Before he falls, Ishida hands his ticket to Kaiji to give to his wife. Sahara panicking, and begins to run.

episodes.title: Tenkû
episodes.plot: Sahara gets to the other side, but falls to his death afterwards. Kaiji takes a glass staircase and wins, but Tonegawa declares his ticket void. The Chairman intervenes and offers Kaiji an opportunity to play E-Card for ¥100 million.

episodes.title: Dohatsu
episodes.plot: Tonegawa explains the rules of E-Card. They are simple, but the odds are against Kaiji, who will be betting his hearing. After the instrument is attached to his ear, the game begins. In the 1st round, Kaiji wins the first two hands.

episodes.title: Kaiwa
episodes.plot: In the 3rd hand of E-Card, Tonegawa wins, saying that the true psychological battle has just begun. In the next 3 rounds, Kaiji draws on the 1st hand but loses the 2nd, shaking his confidence. But the beginning of the 2nd round is a draw.

episodes.title: Honrô
episodes.plot: The 2nd round of the E-Card game continues with Kaiji trying to find a weakness in Tonegawa. He makes a large bet 10mm on the 3rd hand, but loses. The game continues, leaving 4 matches to play and only 4mm before his eardrum is pierced.

episodes.title: Genkai
episodes.plot: The 9th match begins. Kaiji changing his play at the last moment. The chairman punishes Tonegawa for losing, making Kaiji suspicious. He realizes that they are cheating. Now confident, Kaiji bets 18mm, risking more than just his hearing.

episodes.title: Kishin
episodes.plot: Having figured out Tonegawa's method of cheating, Kaiji throws a violent fit in the bathroom to attempt to defeat the sensors in his ear. Too late, Tonegawa realizes Kaiji's trick, who now challenges him for the 12th and final round.

episodes.title: Shinketsu
episodes.plot: The final match of E-Card begins and Kaiji decides to go for another life-or-death gamble, as he is determined not to leave without winning ¥20 million. The round begins as Kaiji is about to pull his last trick.

episodes.title: Shikkô
episodes.plot: Kaiji manages to beat his opponent. The Chairman takes pleasure in forcing Tonegawa to bow, pressing his head onto a red-hot griddle for 10 seconds. Kaiji realizes that the real demon is the sadistic Chairman, and swears to defeat him.

episodes.title: Jadô
episodes.plot: In the restroom the survivors use tissues to stop the bleeding from Kaiji's damaged ear. The tissue box gives Kaiji an idea for a kind of rigged lottery. With all preparations met, he heads out to challenge the Chairman to one more gamble.

episodes.title: Jôken
episodes.plot: The Chairman accepts Kaiji's challenge and gets convinced the to accept the idea of a Tissue Box Raffle. However, the Chairman places three conditions. Reluctantly, Kaiji accepts, and the game begins.

episodes.title: Sôhaku
episodes.plot: Preparations for the Tissue Box Raffle are complete. The Chairman is first to draw a lot, and takes a long time with his selection, but he draws a blank. Kaiji takes his turn, but he cannot find his hidden duplicate winning lot.

episodes.title: Zankô
episodes.plot: The Chairman draws the winning piece, and Kaiji prepares to have his fingers severed. As Kaiji departs with his severed body parts in a bag of ice, he realizes how experienced and cunning Chairman Hyodo is. However he still wants revenge.
